It certainly does make you wonder how many of these are "real", and how man=
y are equipment-based artifacts, overprocessed sounds, simple radio transmi=
ssions, pixelized noise, and seeing dragons in the clouds.=A0 And it makes =
you wonder how to control for the latter, and remove all the poor process, =
questionable processing, and subjectivity, from the analysis.



--- On Fri=
, 5/15/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

umption <purplealiengirl@...>

      Playing acrh skeptic, what va=
lue is a voice for survival evidence if you don't know who it is? How do yo=
u know where it came from? Or can say beyond doubt that it's even "paranorm=
al"? People have millions of these voices by now. 

=A0
=A0F-S


On Thu, Ma=
y 14, 2009 at 10:12 PM, iankerry@rocketmail .com <ian.kerry3@ntlworld .com>=
 wrote:









I have been experimenting with EVP for about a year now (i=
n my home) and i have captured some brilliant evidence for survival.The fir=
st voice i captured was that of a little boy saying ''hello''at 1.30 am.It =
was so clear that others could agree on and the voice could be still heard =
some fifteen feet away from the recorder.I have captured other voices too, =
just as impressive.Unfortun ately i can't upload because my recorder is a m=
icro cassette type.
